com.esri.mo2.svr.map
Class Map

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.svr.map.Map
All Implemented Interfaces:
Canvas, Map
public class Map
extends Object
implements Map

This class provides a server implementation of com.esri.mo2.map.core.Map interface. It's the core component for the server side map applications and run in a so-called headless (no graphic system) environment. Unlike com.esri.mo2.ui.bean.Map class that will create one or more additional threads for managing the map and its data, this class doesn't create threads.

See Also:
Map

setExtent

public boolean setExtent(Envelope r)
change the map extent using the specified Envelope.

This will cause all Layers to be redrawn upon the Display, and, where a Layer is connected with a Remote FeatureClass, may cause a Layer to initiate data retrieval from a remote server.

Note: provided the specified Envelope is valid, it will be re-shaped to preserve the current Display's pixel window aspect ratio - calling code does not need to be concerned with this. If reshaping does occur, the centre of the specified rectangle will coincide with the reshaped rectangle, and the scale will be retained.

If the new Envelope is no different from the current value of getExtent() then no drawing is initiated.

The coordinates used in Envelope depend upon the current coordinate system.

Specified by:
setExtent in interface Map
Parameters:
r - the new mapextent
Returns:
True, if drawing was initiated, False otherwise.
See Also:
Global.isValid(com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.Envelope)

setExtentLimit

public void setExtentLimit(Envelope limit)
change the Map's extent limit. Once you set this property, future drawing of the Map is confined to the specified Envelope, and LayerExtensions associated with Layers in this Map will retrieve data within the confines of this property. You can switch off this behaviour by setting the extent limit property to null. You must redraw the Map to see the change caused by this property.

Specified by:
setExtentLimit in interface Map
Parameters:
limit - the new extent limit, or null == do not use an extent limit

getExtentLimit

public Envelope getExtentLimit()
obtain the Map's current extent limit. If you get null, then this means that the extent limiting behaviour has been switched off - which is the default when the software starts.

Specified by:
getExtentLimit in interface Map
Returns:
the extent limit
See Also:
setExtentLimit(com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.Envelope)

setCoordinateSystem

public void setCoordinateSystem(CoordinateSystem coordSystem)
Description copied from interface: Map
changes the coordinate system used to display data in this Map.

Typically, calling this method will result in changing the map unit and recalculating the map extent.

In the general case (from changing one coordinate system to another) setCoordinateSystem will try to recalculate the new map extent based upon the transformation implied between the two coordinate systems. But, if either the previous or the new map projection is null, the method cannot do the calculation, and will change the mapextent to being the full extent - to ensure something is shown.

If some particular extent for a new coordinate system is needed, setExtent method should be called after calling setCoordinateSystem method.

Specified by:
setCoordinateSystem in interface Map
Parameters:
coordSystem - the new CoordinateSystem, or null , if no CoordinateSystem

getLayer

public Layer getLayer(String layerName)
helper method, returns a reference to a Layer for the given layer name. For convenience, the name of a sub-Layer inside of a GroupLayer can consist of a dot-separated list of names. For instance, if an ImageServerLayer named "MyServer" is present in the Map, and MyServer has a subLayer named "Cities", then the subLayer can be located by calling getLayer("MyServer.Cities"). For now, only one level of Grouplayer is supported. So, you cannot currently locate a subLayer named "GroupLayer.MyServer.Cities".

Specified by:
getLayer in interface Map
Parameters:
layerName - the name of the Layer to be obtained
Returns:
the Layer if found, null == not found

getLayer

public Layer getLayer(int index)
helper method, returns a reference to a Layer in the top-level Layerset of this Map, at the given layer index. Only Layers within the Map's Layerset can be found this way - subLayers cannot be found this way.

Specified by:
getLayer in interface Map
See Also:
GroupLayer.layerAt(int), getLayer(String)

getScale

public double getScale()
convenience method for obtaining the current map scale as a ratio of map units / screen units. This is defined to be the Scale property of the PixelToWorldTransform property of this Map. This is not a "true scale" but it is the current scale used for determining scale dependencies.

Specified by:
getScale in interface Map
Returns:
the current map scale

getVersion

public static final String getVersion()
get a printable version number string.

This consists of the following "M.I.B.b" where M is the major version number, I is the minor version number, B is the major build number and b is minor build number.

Returns:
the version number as a string

parseEnvelope

public static final Envelope parseEnvelope(Envelope e,
                                           String s)
                                    throws InvalidValuesException,
                                           ParseException
parse a String containing 4 double precision values that are either blank or comma-separated and return the resulting Envelope. For example, "0.0,0.0 8.0,7.0".

Parameters:
e - optional Envelope to receive the result, if e==null then a new Envelope is created
s - the string to be parsed
Returns:
the result envelope
Throws:
InvalidValuesException - if there is other than exactly 4 values
ParseException - if any one of the values is invalid

copy

public Map copy()
Create a copy of the current Map object.The method creates a new Map component by calling "new Map()". The AcetateLayers and bookmarks in the previous one are not.

Specified by:
copy in interface Map

addLayers

public void addLayers(Layer[] layers)
Adds several layers to the map using the following strategy:
  • any FeatureLayer having a feature type of point, will be added at the top.
  • any FeatureLayer having a feature type of line, will be inserted just above the first line layer (if any) that is already in the Map.
  • any FeatureLayer having a feature type of polygon, will be inserted just above the first polygon layer (if any) that is already in the Map.
  • all other types of Layer, such as images, will be added at the bottom of the Map

Parameters:
layers - an array of zero or more layers to be added to the map
